meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that stops the flow of a liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The plumber installed shutoffs to stop the water from flowing.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the shutoffs before starting any maintenance work.
meanings.sent3: The shutoffs decided to take a break and caused a mini flood in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the shutoffs, halting any distractions in her path.
meanings.sent5: The bright red shutoffs stood out in the sea of pipes, ready to do their job.

meanings.definition: The act of stopping the flow of something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden shutoffs of the water supply surprised the residents.
meanings.sent2: The shutoffs of the electricity during the storm caused a blackout.
meanings.sent3: The shutoffs of the music abruptly ended the party, leaving everyone in silence.
meanings.sent4: His shutoffs of emotions made it hard for others to understand him.
meanings.sent5: The shutoffs of the production line led to a temporary halt in manufacturing.

meanings.definition: A location where something is turned off or closed.
meanings.sent1: The shutoffs for the air conditioning are located in the utility room.
meanings.sent2: She found the shutoffs for the gas line behind the shed.
meanings.sent3: The shutoffs for the roller coaster were mistakenly triggered, causing confusion among riders.
meanings.sent4: The old factory had shutoffs scattered throughout the building for safety.
meanings.sent5: In case of emergency, the main shutoffs for the water supply are near the entrance.
